title: About me
text: I am a middle-aged, nonbinary person. My pronouns are they / them. I live in Edwardsville, IL with a spouse (Ed), a teenager (Isabella), and two adopted cats (Bo and Cap’n). I was born and lived in Italy until I was 20. My previous career was in science, specifically in research and development, where I was a director of R&D in the field of biotechnology. I have several advanced degrees, including a PhD in Chemistry and a Master of Divinity from Eden Seminary in St. Louis, where I graduated in 2022. I received Preliminary Fellowship from the UUA Ministerial Fellowship Committee in April 2023 and was ordained in April 2024 by the congregation in Montclair, New Jersey where I also did my internship. In my spare time I like to walk, read, do yoga and meditation, and take naps.

title: FAQ
text:
I am passionate about social justice, and about working towards ending oppressions. I think that every person who works for justice even in the smallest way makes a difference. Maybe they don’t see it, but it’s there. I am passionate about family, including chosen family and community. I think that humans are gregarious creatures and spiritual life is best grown in community. I am passionate about authenticity. I wish that more people would allow themselves to be vulnerable, to not fear failing or revealing too much of themselves. I am also passionate about rest and joy and beauty. These are necessary to survive.



There is a Love holding and connecting all.



Because this is a faith that saved my life, that taught me the joy of community and the fire of commitment.



Yes, upon request.



Through my email, strupia@uuma.org

title: Gallery
text:
Earth Day 2023


Children and Youth Circle on Earth Day 2023, that I co-created with the Music Intern. (Fun Fact: the photo on the About Me page shows the size of one of the sunflowers…


















Flower Communion


Celebrating the 100th anniversary of Norbert Čapek’s Flower Communion by leading worship at First UU in Orange.


















Montclair Pride 2023


The UUCM Booth at the Montclair Pride which I helped organize.


















NJ Lobby Day


Lobby Day in Trenton NJ, working towards legislating reparations.


















Preliminary Fellowship


In 2023 I received Preliminary Fellowship and I was able to be at the Service of the Living Tradition at GA. It was a really special moment.


















Pride service


Pride worship service.


















Transgender Day of Visibility 2023


I was honored to be asked to speak on a panel for Trans Day of Visibility 2023.


















Wedding !


I officiated a Pagan wedding on May 1st (Beltane) between two non-binary people at the UU fellowship in Wayne NJ.

title: Rev. Dr. Sabrina Trupia
text:
Welcome!


I am glad you are here.
There is a Love holding us.
There is a Love holding all that we love.
There is a Love holding all.
I rest in this Love.
– Rev. Dr. Rebecca Parker
